positive.review: Well thought out idle game with lots of fun mechanics. Would recommend.
Great game, can be slow at times and surprisingly quick at others
My PC ran for a whole year straight without shutting off because of this game.

Ngl I kinda forget about the game and then come back to a bunch of stuff
10/10
What was my review again?

I've only played a few hours, but it would be cool if you could change the character slime colours, and effects. like rainbow or chrome etc via unlock

It's also pretty cool if you choose option 2, you can get level ups on your characters while not playing.

Very deep game. Deep and complex games like this don't get enough credit. Yes there are QOL improvements that you gotta pay for but how else are they gonna make money if people complain about these having to already be in the game.
Better than the first, but, unfortunately, not finished.
If you like incremental games then this is pretty good.
Lots of upgrades
good game
Awesome Idler

A strange case of a game being underrated at Mostly Positive on steam. I'm not sure why this isn't heralded as one of the best incrementals of current year. Long term game with graphics and animations, with lots of interlinking complex systems that take time for the player to process and understand. I find this game to be unique because a lot of graphically enhanced incrementals tend to be very simplistic/gimmicky, and the genre in general has way too many games where you just watch numbers go up or perform a very simple routine of tier 1 resets followed by a slow push to tier 2 and so on with little thought or reason to what you're doing. IEH2 is refreshing because while it still has those tropes, there's a ton of other mechanics to interact with and lots of little "ah hah" moments as you piece together the bonuses you can get from everything and how you can progress faster. It's genuinely engaging stuff.


Maybe there's a lot of misconception that leads to people leaving negative reviews? There's a lot of content in the game but some stuff is openly labeled as WIP as opposed to just not being there at all. I think the learning curve is steep and people see that there are microtransactions and just use that as a excuse to not bother learning the game. After a few days I was able to start getting thousands of premium currency from dailies in addition to what the game was giving me for quests and quickly bought some useful QoL upgrades from the premium shop. It's very inoffensive once you get into the swing of things. I've seen some reviews claim the developer is abandoning the project, but I checked the discord and it looked like the dev was spending time moving into a new place, reassessing the state of the game, and is still relatively active? In any case, If you like the genre and value complex decision trees in your incrementals, you should download this and give it a shot.

yeah it's alright, dont know what the other reviews are talking about with the epic coins when you get them daily - did you noobs never play ngu idle? it's a bloody idle game, sits in the background and you make progress in time

game fell off for me at world ascension, the usual part of these games where you reset everything and build back up to get better than before but i dont wanna do that
Well thought out idle game with lots of fun mechanics. Would recommend.
Great game, can be slow at times and surprisingly quick at others
My PC ran for a whole year straight without shutting off because of this game.

Ngl I kinda forget about the game and then come back to a bunch of stuff
10/10
What was my review again?

I've only played a few hours, but it would be cool if you could change the character slime colours, and effects. like rainbow or chrome etc via unlock

It's also pretty cool if you choose option 2, you can get level ups on your characters while not playing.

Very deep game. Deep and complex games like this don't get enough credit. Yes there are QOL improvements that you gotta pay for but how else are they gonna make money if people complain about these having to already be in the game.

Best idler I've ever played, there's a lot to do compared to other idle / incremental games where you just watch numbers go up. You have gear, skills, quests, pets, and tons of other stuff to unlock and do. People are saying you have to pay a lot of money but I haven't seen any of that after a few months of playing. The graphics might  be off-putting for some people but I think its worth a try if you can get past that.
Better than the first, but, unfortunately, not finished.

pretty fun, but lacking visually. the graphics aren't pretty. I couldn't understand how the get weapons for the angel, or in general upgrade or get different equipment. If the art would be updated and it would be easier to understand equipment and such, it'd be better. also different background tracks would be nice. 
decent game, was nice for a few hours.
Easily the best incremental game I've ever played, with thousands of hours of content.
An extremely fun Idle Incremental game! This was my first non-clicker type idle game, and I can say it was definitely a great find.

Does what it says it does.
Got my moneys worth!
If you like incremental games then this is pretty good.
Lots of upgrades
good game
Fun fun.
Awesome Idler
Good mix of idle and clicker.
Fun game.
Hooooly

negative.review:
Even though the game is advertised as finished, it isn't. There is still a lot of content missing and there hasn't been an update in almost a year, so I can't blame anyone for saying it's dead.

What's there so far is good, but it's disappointing to build up your party only for the ultimate dungeons to be in an alpha phase and for many town buildings to be unfinished.
If they do complete it at some point, it's worth a shot, but as it is right now, I wouldn't recommend it.

Personally I cant get behind it. Too many systems that I lost track of. 

You can think of this more like an active idle game that you need to micromanage constantly, especially at the start. 

If that's your cup of tea, you have a whole kettle with this.
Full release would mean that ascenion tiers 2 and 3 were out and the guild buildings that have no effect would have their effects.

this dev clearly does not understand most people do not have 8 hours a day to play this game. there is way too much to do, way too soon. On top of that, so many mechanics and features which are poorly explained, and very rapidly overwhelming since they keep progressing and get more complicated before you had a reasonable chance to understand them. The result? You want to play, but once you're back in, you just feel lost and close the game again. Or at least, that's my feedback after a couple days. Not for me at all, and I have played dozens of idle and incremental games. I'd recommend implementing automations as the game unlocks more stuff to do, so the more basic stuff gets done without the need for any input, so you can concentrate on the newer stuff, andnot have to spend 8 hours a day and get a phd on the side.

Game is unfinished. Bugs throughout, tooltips missing, game functions incomplete, mechanics and menu systems not quite polished to a sufficient level. Things like switching areas and all your items just, disappear... imagine farming all night, wake up hit one button and all the gear you just farmed up just disappears... just gone, nothing you can do. What's even the point of playing a game like this at that point?

Even though the game is advertised as finished, it isn't. There is still a lot of content missing and there hasn't been an update in almost a year, so I can't blame anyone for saying it's dead.

What's there so far is good, but it's disappointing to build up your party only for the ultimate dungeons to be in an alpha phase and for many town buildings to be unfinished.
If they do complete it at some point, it's worth a shot, but as it is right now, I wouldn't recommend it.

Personally I cant get behind it. Too many systems that I lost track of. 

You can think of this more like an active idle game that you need to micromanage constantly, especially at the start. 

If that's your cup of tea, you have a whole kettle with this.
Full release would mean that ascenion tiers 2 and 3 were out and the guild buildings that have no effect would have their effects.

The result? You want to play, but once you're back in, you just feel lost and close the game again. Or at least, that's my feedback after a couple days. Not for me at all, and I have played dozens of idle and incremental games. I'd recommend implementing automations as the game unlocks more stuff to do, so the more basic stuff gets done without the need for any input, so you can concentrate on the newer stuff, andnot have to spend 8 hours a day and get a phd on the side.

Game is unfinished. Bugs throughout, tooltips missing, game functions incomplete, mechanics and menu systems not quite polished to a sufficient level. Things like switching areas and all your items just, disappear... imagine farming all night, wake up hit one button and all the gear you just farmed up just disappears... just gone, nothing you can do. What's even the point of playing a game like this at that point?
it's a micro management game.  You have lots of things to do.  If you're into no-life-ing your games and looking for things to do.  It's great.  So is Grind Chase.  Not for me, tho.
played 11 hours then close game and came back to it a few days later and all progress is reset
lazily put together game, first 1 is 10x better

Game is unfinished. Bugs throughout, tooltips missing, game functions incomplete, mechanics and menu systems not quite polished to a sufficient level. Things like switching areas and all your items just, disappear... imagine farming all night, wake up hit one button and all the gear you just farmed up just disappears... just gone, nothing you can do. What's even the point of playing a game like this at that point?
it's a micro management game.  You have lots of things to do.  If you're into no-life-ing your games and looking for things to do.  It's great.  So is Grind Chase.  Not for me, tho.
played 11 hours then close game and came back to it a few days later and all progress is reset
lazily put together game, first 1 is 10x better

Even though the game is advertised as finished, it isn't. There is still a lot of content missing and there hasn't been an update in almost a year, so I can't blame anyone for saying it's dead.

What's there so far is good, but it's disappointing to build up your party only for the ultimate dungeons to be in an alpha phase and for many town buildings to be unfinished.
If they do complete it at some point, it's worth a shot, but as it is right now, I wouldn't recommend it.

Personally I cant get behind it. Too many systems that I lost track of. 

You can think of this more like an active idle game that you need to micromanage constantly, especially at the start. 

If that's your cup of tea, you have a whole kettle with this.
Full release would mean that ascenion tiers 2 and 3 were out and the guild buildings that have no effect would have their effects.

this dev clearly does not understand most people do not have 8 hours a day to play this game. there is way too much to do, way too soon. On top of that, so many mechanics and features which are poorly explained, and very rapidly overwhelming since they keep progressing and get more complicated before you had a reasonable chance to understand them. The result? You want to play, but once you're back in, you just feel lost and close the game again. Or at least, that's my feedback after a couple days. Not for me at all, and I have played dozens of idle and incremental games. I'd recommend implementing automations as the game unlocks more stuff to do, so the more basic stuff gets done without the need for any input, so you can concentrate on the newer stuff, andnot have to spend 8 hours a day and get a phd on the side.
